"},{"id":12,"type":"Change of Heart","appellant":"76561198213758648 (☁ Cloudy ☁)","alts":null,"description":"Around 4 months ago when I was looking on backpack.tf, I found a guy who wanted to buy a Golden Frying Pan. I was bored at the time and figured it would be funny to make a joke by sending him an offer for it., in this offer I wrote the following: "[i]Here is your golden frying pan :D (If you can't see it there's a steam bug, it happened to me sometimes too.)[/i]" And I picked some of his keys but I added no items. So I understand that this looked that I was attempting to scam him, but I promise I wasnt. I thought that it would be a funny joke that he would laugh at. Sadly my english was terrible at this time so I found it difficult to explain that to him via trade messages, because of this he thought I was attempting to scam him and he reported me on SteamREP. I am now banned but I promise that the whole thing was a misunderstanding and I would never try to scam someone of their items, and I have never attempted to scam anyone to this day. I want to apologise for being stupid and for greating that issue. I will never do anything like that again, I hope you will understand and forgive me.","evidence":"(Sadly it's not my photo, I can't find the trade in my history, luckily the guy who reported me was able to take a screenshot of it.) https://files.f-o-g.eu/260fa11a48d35a2gf37g8c350b2c6f52 ","assignee_id":null,"state_id":4,"views":256,"locked":1,"creator_id":56,"modificator_id":56,"created_at":"22.08.2016 16:43:23","updated_at":"2016-08-28 15:34:52","state":"Accepted","assignee":"

"},{"id":45,"type":"Change of Heart","appellant":"76561198159194897 (| ✪ KingKrush ✪ |)","alts":null,"description":"[b]What was your in-game name when you got banned?[/b] [i]Senpai Krushz CSGORumble.com[/i] [b]When did it happen?[/b] [i]04/03/16[/i] [b]What's the specified reason?[/b] [i]I was Banned for attempting a Paypal invoice scam. It was my idea to attempt this Scam and solely my idea and I take full responsibility for this attempted scam. I talked to the victim and whatever was said and done was all me.[/i] [b]Why do you think you should be unbanned?[/b] [i]I believe I was righteously banned. However i'm also a strong believer in second chance in certain circumstances. I do not wish to be known as a Scammer, Despite me attempting a scam. I understand it is hard to believe me when I say "I will not do it again" since it is cliche and many scammers repeat the same mistake. My idea is not to sugar coat any of my actions , neither do i have a reason to lie. The actions I made were unacceptable and unjustifiable, I should have never attempted the scam or even thought about scamming. I foolishly try'ed to scam a fellow trader and was caught red handed and rightfully so. I would like to be unbanned simply because it was a one off thing , and it will never happen again , never again will I scam it was low of me and undeniably stupid. I would appreciate if the ban could be lifted. However if the un-ban is not possible I understand it is I who is to blame.[/i]","evidence":"","assignee_id":null,"state_id":4,"views":490,"locked":1,"creator_id":128,"modificator_id":128,"created_at":"09.10.2016 16:21:07","updated_at":"2016-12-04 18:12:33","state":"Accepted","assignee":"

"},{"id":47,"type":"Change of Heart","appellant":"76561198050880697 (The Old Medic)","alts":null,"description":"[b]Type of appeal[/b] [i]SteamRep tag removal/downgrade[/i] [b]What was your in-game name when you got banned?[/b] [i]ZeGermanMedic[/i] [b]When did it happen?[/b] [i]1240~ days ago[/i] [b]What's the specified reason?[/b] [i]I tried to sell Noclip on servers I wasnt an Admin on. I also claimed to be able to "hack the server" to give people their Noclip. Here is the link to my report: [url]http://forums.steamrep.com/threads/76561198050880697-zegermanmedic.29667/[/url][/i] [b]Why do you think you should be unbanned?[/b] [i]I already wrote a previous Appeal 3 months ago to downgrade my Scammer Tag to a Caution Tag ([url]https://forums.f-o-g.eu/threads/steamrep-tag-removal-downgrade-ban-appeal-the-old-medic.12681/[/url]). Now, after the 90 days waiting period, I would like to finally settle this chapter of my life once and for all. Please see this as an open apology for my past behaviour. What I did 3,5 years ago, as I said before, obviously was a childish mistake which I do still regret of commiting. And I will for sure not try to trick people for their Items ever again, because I learned from this experience, and I hope you can see that. [i]I wouldnt bring it over my heart again, since I have learned in these 3 years like many others how it feels to lose Items / Money to pure greed.[/i] I am es[i]pecially not interested in anymore trouble due to the reason that I have built up a certain amount of reputation ever since the incident, and I would never - Never - risk to lose it all again just for a few quick bucks[/i]. [i][i][i][i]Nowadays I am fully aware of the fact, that t[/i]here is absolutely no room for for Scammers in the Trading Community. [/i]I wasn't aware of what these few chat messages may mean for me in the next few years or the people they could have affected.[/i][/i] Today, I am a more mature part of this Community, that I have known and loved for such a long time, than I have ever been before. 3+ years back when I attemted to scam, I was 12 years old and more than just selfish. I am now almost 16, still play TF2 after 4,7k hours, and love all of the different Communities that this game has to offer. And not for any amount of money would I consider being excluded from one of my favorites, the Trading Community. I trade, I play the game, I create video content and sell SFM content to other users which pay first, make friends, help others with problems and so much more because of my passion for the game. - I hope I made this clear, because I almost cant express what this means to me. [/i] Lastly, it was a one time incident, and will always be. I tried it on 3 trading servers / 1 ctf_2Fort server on only 1 single day, and it was luckily not even successful. By no means do I think the tag(s) were unrightfully applied at the time, but given the time passed since (3,5 years), I want to be able to look forwards - not into the past. - ZEG [List of alts: [url]http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198122827281[/url] - [url]http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198156015672[/url] - [url]http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198021823701[/url] ]","evidence":"","assignee_id":null,"state_id":4,"views":181,"locked":1,"creator_id":135,"modificator_id":135,"created_at":"16.10.2016 12:37:20","updated_at":"2016-10-17 20:23:27","state":"Accepted","assignee":"

"},{"id":52,"type":"Change of Heart","appellant":"76561198035827891 ({W.I.A} TisTheSeasonToBeScary)","alts":null,"description":"[quote]Hello, this is my first ever appeal so sorry if doesn't fit your requirements. Regarding the "scam" I admit I ran. However I didn't do this for no reason. I had met the victim on an 100% critical hit trade server on tf2. I had played on this server every single day for the past couple months, before I was banned from it of course. I was well known and had never scammed anyone before. This person I did not recognize from ever being on the server and was challenging people to duels. Being scammed before I wanted to make sure this guy was legit. I checked his profile and it said he had limited account, hadn't been on steam that long, yet he items far more expensive than mine. I figured "what the heck, lets do it", I had never gambled before so I started out with the lowest he would go, a specialized killstreak iron bomber kit which was around a key at the time I believe. I wanted to test him though, as a wise person would want to know his opponent before just gambling it away. He accepted but was quite hasty I might add to get to the actual fight. I noticed this person was not that good. He were playing like someone who didn't know how to play. This didn't make sense though, how could someone bad be in possession of good items and yet be offering to duel for them? I was wary but I didn't think much of it. However when the real fight came he was unstoppable. Here lies the reason I fled. I was ignorant in the ways of gambling and in my eyes I had just been played. In my eyes I had seen someone deliberately play bad to fool me into betting better stuff which he would ultimately win. So I "ran" because I felt that it was an unfair and misleading fight and made a poor decision of expressing that. So in conclusion I admit, I lost and I just want to pay my dues to get this curse of being marked off of me. I never meant to scam and never will again but you also shouldn't go around misleading people to lure them in. I just want the victim to know I was wrong but he should know what he did wasn't right either. Thank you for your time.​[/quote] ","evidence":"","assignee_id":null,"state_id":4,"views":610,"locked":1,"creator_id":149,"modificator_id":149,"created_at":"24.10.2016 03:41:58","updated_at":"2017-01-02 15:23:37","state":"Accepted","assignee":"

"},{"id":101,"type":"Policy Change","appellant":"76561197998635950 (Sub Zero)","alts":null,"description":"[b]Type of appeal[/b] [i]SteamRep tag removal/downgrade [/i]​ [b]What was your in-game name when you got banned?[/b] [i]Sub Zero [/i]​ [b]When did it happen?[/b] [i]March 22, 2015 11:19 AM GMT+08:00 [/i]​ [b]What's the specified reason?[/b] [i][url]http://forums.f-o-g.eu/threads/5627-sub-zero-76561197998635950-a.html[/url] Committed a GODTIER TRADE with a scammer alt of a marked user [/i]​ [b]Why do you think you should be unbanned?[/b] Its been a while since I got my caution tag. Back then I traded a darkblaze KE for a green black hole viewfinder. It was a trade offer just sitting there and without hesitation I accepted it. Then when I joined a server one of the admins asked if it was such a good idea especially since one of them told me that the person i did that trade with had unconfirmed reports. I brushed it off because I didnt think unconfirmed reports didnt count. Back then it counted and so the result was a caution tag. I decided to come back and I noticed this. http://forums.steamrep.com/threads/policy-change-trades-with-scammer-policy-end-of-life.119528/ In the case I do get appealed I promise to be more vigilant and check who I trade with before accepting trade offers.","evidence":"","assignee_id":null,"state_id":4,"views":99,"locked":1,"creator_id":215,"modificator_id":215,"created_at":"11.12.2016 09:34:37","updated_at":"2016-12-11 15:41:10","state":"Accepted","assignee":"

Appeal Reason: [Change of Heart] I will never scam again. Victim Repayment: No, I committed no fraud or had no direct victims Previous appeals: Yes, I appealed here before and the admin told me to appeal again at a later date ​ Alternate Accounts: None​ Appeal: Appeal: You denied my last appeal, however the first appeal with 1 day after the caution tag was applied. Why I got tagged: I posted in a forum asking for +reps on my account. Simple things just like nice profile, nice inventory, etc. (I had a decent inventory at the time), and just things of good nature. I admit I let some slip through the cracks that said nice trade etc, but I also have a lot of legitimate rep as well because I used to very active. (Haven't played Cs:go except for a few times over the last 400~ days. Why should should the tag get removed? Honestly, I only wanted the +reps to make my profile look cool and I never considered the as a valid rep for trading. In fact, I don't think anyone uses profile rep to access the validity of a person's CSGO trading history. If some people do then I admit, I was sorry for any deception on my part, but I never engaged in any scamming/fraud etc. But even with this in mind it does not excuse my action that I posted a thread in a CSGO rep group, and then lied about it to try and get out of it. I personally just wanted lots of comments on my profile (as you can see my profile is very neat/I care a lot about its looks) but I admit my action was wrong. I tried to lie in my appeal claiming it wasn't me because I didn't know that I would even be able to get this overturned by admitting the truth that I simply messed up. I was honestly just in "freakout" mode because I had no idea what a caution tag would do with my account. --I know this is very wrong, and I consider myself a different person. (I know this doesn't look good in my case, but I can trying to be as transparent as possible.) Overall, I have made a lot of trades/market transactions over my 9 years on steam and have never had any issues/reported before, but this again doesn't excuse what I did. I will like to say I'm sorry and hope I can take this as a lesson and move on with my caution tag removed. https://trade.lethal.zone/threads/76561197996568038-typpi.24680/#post-300416 As an added bonus, I think I have had this caution tag for about 400 days now and I have learned to accept it on my profile as a sign that I screwed up. At the time was worth approximately 1 key. It is now worth 7.22 refined metal as I am writing this. I had a listing for the Non-Tradable Dangeresque, Too? Since this was a Non-Tradable item the buyer in this case Hellcat had to provide me with Gift Wrap as I was not covering it. They traded me the item and Instead of wrapping it, I took the Gift Wrap and immediately after doing so: blocked them on steam. I never bothered trying getting in contact with Hellcat until a month ago since I wasn't trading much, but nowdays I trade a lot more often and its preventing me from trading. I always had the idea of wanting to get my SteamRep mark removed but didn't know the procedure involved. I am unable to get in contact with Hellcat as they have not accepted my friend invitation on steam and blocked me a couple times. I have tried everything I possibly can to get in contact with them - asking my friends to write comments on their steam profile and add them, attempting to send trade offers but they have a private inventory so it does not allow me and adding them myself but to no success. After looking into their profile section and reading the comments, I added a few of their friends and luckily enough one of them accepted me. I spoke with them for a bit and came to this conclusion, in their own words "he believes avoiding other people getting scammed is far more important than revoking scam warning marks" They are acting as if I went to a bank and robbed it when I scammed a Gift Wrap. For a more information: I provided screenshots of our conversation under evidence.  2. Trading with scammers/alts March 25 2015 - I committed a high-tier trade with a scammer who went by the name "Slushy|CauldronCrones!" Since I was fairly new to trading at the time, I was unaware of them being a marked scammer and was unaware there was a rule on backpack.tf stating if you traded with marked scammers that it would warrant you a warning/tag depending on how many times you traded. In this case, I only committed one high-tier trade and I am assuming was granted a caution tag. I am fairly certain the rules about trading with scammers was a lot more strict compared to the rules now, but I am not 100% certain. Regardless, trading with a marked scammer 7 years ago is not worthy of a ban anymore. I would like to also note I have 3 negative trust factors on my backpack.tf profile two of them NOT being valid (first two), despite reporting the negative ratings, they are still on my backpack.tf profile. I just thought this was worth mentioning in case this was used against me as a way of saying that I have not changed or I'm still a scammer. GOLD_KING left feedback about a year ago:"The man tried to cheat by offering a disgusting offer! DO NOT TRADE WITH THIS BAD PERSON'      My take: Simply offering on someone's item is not considered a scam or by any means 'cheating' as he refered to it as. I offered a Vivid Plasma Glengarry Bonnet which was priced at 17.5 keys on Backpack.tf, however this was an outdated pricing. There was a sell order listing for 25 keys and I was using that was reference for the pricing. I offered on their Max's Severed Head, which at the time was roughly 21-22 keys. I remember communicating with this invidivual and found it particulary difficult due to the language barier. English was not their first language. People lowball on items all the time but does the other person go out of their way to report the individual on backpack.tf? No.  KF left feedback 7 years ago: "This guy before tried to scam my unusual for a old price unusual.He want to use this [url]http://backpack.tf/vote/id/52a643544dd7b83c7d8b4568[/url] to trade my 4.75bud unusual hat with 2earbud with some key.However,that not really 6.18-7.06 bud. when i see that suggestion explain only cost 2~4 earbud . so this scammer tried to scam about the range.He think me don't know about that.don't trade with him!DONT TRUST HIM" My take: KF was using an out dated price suggestion for pricing my item instead of looking at the active sell orders. There was a listing at the time of my unusual being sold for 6.18-7.06 buds as mentioned, which is why I used that price range as reference. He did not supply any proof of the sell order listings, our chat logs or even the name of his own unusual. His only sort of "proof" is an outdated price suggestion which means nothing. No proof what so ever, should be deleted. Pr1nce left feedback from 7 years ago: "gift wrap scammer, do not trade or trust in any circumstance" My take: Valid. In Conclusion - I was initially given a caution for scamming Hellcat on May 2nd 2014, 11:48Pm and later SteamRep marked on the March 25 2015 for committing a high-tier trade with 'Slushy|CauldronCrones!'. It has now been over 2535 days of my ban and I have reflected on my older self and since then learnt some valuable life lessons and grown so much as a person. I would like to be given a second chance to do the right thing. I am a changed person and I do not like being compared to my older self. I do not agree with being marked as a scammer since this incident was minor considering what happened. I should be given a caution tag at the very least. I know that I have not repayed Hellcat, but there is literally no way for me to do it and if I could do it, I would in a heart beat. I have attached pictures below.
